newsitem.title: USA: NYCE cotton called to open flat to up 0.20 cent.
newsitem.headline: NYCE cotton called to open flat to up 0.20 cent.

text.p: NYCE cotton futures were called to open unchanged to 0.20 cent firmer Thursday on the heels of a slightly encouraging export and sales report, dealers said.
USDA put new sales for the week ended June 12 at 80,900 480-lb bales in the 1996/97 crop, and at 67,700 bales in the new crop.
Market sources expect the data to give the market a slight boost and pegged resistance in new-crop December at 75.60 cents and then at 76.10 cents.
"The report was a bit better than we expected, but there continues to be overhead resistance in July and December by producer selling," a trader said.
Support was pegged at 75.10 cents a lb for December delivery.
Wednesday, new-crop December settled at 75.40 cents, down 0.14 cent. Spot July ended 0.13 lower at 72.53 cents, with the rest 0.07 higher to 0.15 lower.
